page.title: 19The Nuneaton Mosque
page.content: Nuneaton{Muslims}used to pray in {Riversley Park,}but as their numbers swelled they persuaded the local council to allow them to convert two houses in{Edward Street}into a mosque. In 1976 they acquired a piece of land in{Frank Street}on which to build a new mosque. The architect was{Mr.R.A. {Zaki}who was born in Iraq, but educated in London. It took 5 years to build as work stopped for 1 year due to a shortage of funds. The total cost was Â£793,890. The Mosque faces{Mecca,the Holy City, and is said to be one of the finest in the country. More and more Muslims are coming to Nuneaton just to pray in this mosque. Other facilities include a kitchen, library, guestroom and classrooms where local children attend lessons for 2 hours each weekday evening.
